info.title: Assess API
info.description:
Codat's Assess API enable you to make smarter credit decisions on your small business customers. Assess enriches your customer's accounting, commerce and banking data to surface actionable insights you didn't have before.

[Read more...](https://www.codat.io/assess/)

[See our OpenAPI spec](https://github.com/codatio/oas)

get.summary: List account categories

detailType.description: Most granular chart of account type.

detailTypeDescription.description: A description of the fully categorized (to detail type) account.

examples.detailTypeDescription: Use 'Cash' for cash in the bank or held on premise. This should include overdrawn accounts.
Use 'General services' for income generated from services the company performs or usage fees charged.

parameters.name: dataType
parameters.description: A key for a Codat data type.

get.summary: Get data integrity status

type.description: The data type which the data type in the URL has been matched against. For example, if you've matched accountTransactions and banking-transactions, and you call this endpoint with accountTransactions in the URL, this property would be banking-transactions.

lastMatched.description: The date the matching algorithm last ran against the company’s data type specified.

currentStatus.description: The current status of the most recently run matching algorithm.

statusMessage.description: Detailed explanation supporting the status value.

source.description: An array of strings. The connection IDs for the type specified in the url.

target.description: An array of strings. The connection IDs for the type being matched to.

amounts.description: Only returned for transactions. For accounts, there is nothing returned.

currency.title: Currency
currency.description:
The currency data type in Codat is the [ISO 4217](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_4217) currency code. e.g. _GBP_.

## Unknown currencies

In line with the ISO 4217 specification, the code _XXX_ is used when the data source does not return a currency for a transaction. 

There are only a very small number of edge cases where this currency code is returned by the Codat system.

dates.description: Only returned for transactions. For accounts, there is nothing returned.

minOverlappingDate.description: Earliest date where transactions exist in both accounting and banking platforms.

maxOverlappingDate.description: Latest date where transactions exist in both account and banking platforms.

get.description: Gets match status for a given company and datatype.

schema.description: Unique identifier for your SMB in Codat.

parameters.name: dataType
parameters.description: A key for a Codat data type.

get.summary: Get data integrity summary

type.description: The data type which the data type in the URL has been matched against. For example, if you've matched accountTransactions and banking-transactions, and you call this endpoint with accountTransactions in the URL, this property would be banking-transactions.

matchPercentage.description: The percentage of the absolute value of transactions of the type specified in the route which have a match.

unmatched.description: The sum of the absolute value of transactions of the type specified in the route which don't have a match.

matched.description: The sum of the absolute value of transactions of the type specified in the route which have a match.

total.description: The total of unmatched and matched.

currency.title: Currency
currency.description:
The currency data type in Codat is the [ISO 4217](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_4217) currency code. e.g. _GBP_.

## Unknown currencies

In line with the ISO 4217 specification, the code _XXX_ is used when the data source does not return a currency for a transaction. 

There are only a very small number of edge cases where this currency code is returned by the Codat system.

matchPercentage.description: The percentage of records of the type specified in the route which have a match.

unmatched.description: The number of records of the type specified in the route which don't have a match.

matched.description: The number of records of the type specified in the route which do have a match.

total.description: The total of unmatched and matched.

connectionId.description: ID GUID representing the connection of the accounting or banking platform.

id.description: A concatenation of the accountId and transactionId, in the format accountId_transactionId. This is unique to data integrity.

type.description: The data type which the data type in the URL has been matched against. For example, if you've matched accountTransactions and banking-transactions, and you call this endpoint with accountTransactions in the URL, this property would be banking-transactions.

connectionId.description: ID GUID representing the connection of the accounting or banking platform.

get.summary: List finanicial metrics

currency.title: Currency
currency.description:
The currency data type in Codat is the [ISO 4217](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_4217) currency code. e.g. _GBP_.

## Unknown currencies

In line with the ISO 4217 specification, the code _XXX_ is used when the data source does not return a currency for a transaction. 

There are only a very small number of edge cases where this currency code is returned by the Codat system.

fromDate.description: The date from which the report starts.

toDate.description: The date on which the report ends (inclusive of day).

value.description:
The top level metric value that is calculated for the specified period. 

If the system cannot calculate for that period, the value will be null. The system will still show the metric inputs.

name.description: The name of the metric input e.g. “Current Assets”, “Capital Expenditure”.

value.description: The positive or negative number of the input value.

details.title: AssessErrorDetails
details.description: Dictionary list outlining the missing properties or allowed values.

message.example: There are uncategorized accounts IDs, see details.

details.title: AssessErrorDetails
details.description: Dictionary list outlining the missing properties or allowed values.

errors.description: If there are no errors, an empty array is returned.

message.example: Account categories data has not been synced

errors.message: There are uncategorized accounts, see details.
Account categories data has not been synced

get.description: Gets all the available financial metrics for a given company, over one or more periods.

parameters.name: reportDate
parameters.description: The date in which the report is created up to. Users must specify a specific date, however the response will be provided for the full month.

parameters.name: periodLength
parameters.description: The number of months per period. E.g. 2 = 2 months per period.

parameters.name: numberOfPeriods
parameters.description: The number of periods to return.  There will be no pagination as a query parameter, however Codat will limit the number of periods to request to 12 periods.

parameters.name: showMetricInputs
parameters.description: If set to true, then the system includes the input values within the response.

schema.description: Unique identifier for your SMB in Codat.
Unique identifier for a company's data connection.

get.summary: Enhanced Profit and Loss
get.description: Gets a fully categorized profit and loss statement for a given company, over one or more period(s).

parameters.name: reportDate
parameters.description: The date in which the report is created up to. Users must specify a specific date, however the response will be provided for the full month.

parameters.name: periodLength
parameters.description: The number of months per period. E.g. 2 = 2 months per period.

parameters.name: numberOfPeriods
parameters.description: The number of periods to return.  There will be no pagination as a query parameter, however Codat will limit the number of periods to request to 12 periods.

parameters.name: includeDisplayNames
parameters.description: Shows the dimensionDisplayName and itemDisplayName in measures to make the report data human-readable.

schema.description:
Assess reports follow a consistent structure. Reports contain four sections of information:

1. Report definition information such as:
  a. The report info (e.g. enhanced_profit_and_loss).
  b. The display name of the report (e.g. Enhanced Profit and Loss).
2. Information about the dimension contained in the reports such as:
  a. The type of dimension (e.g. datetime, recordRef).
  b. The display name of the dimension (e.g. Period, Category type, Category sub type).
  c. The details about each item within the dimension (e.g. displayName:"Jan 2022", start:"...", end:"...", id:"...", name:"...").
3. Information about the measures contained in the report such as:
  a. The display name of the measure (e.g. value of account, percentage change).
  b. The type of the measure (e.g. currency, percentage).
  c. The unit of the measure (e.g. %, GBP).
4. The data for the report. When the *includeDisplayName* parameter is set to *true*, it shows the *dimensionDisplayName* and *itemDisplayName* to make the data human-readable. The default setting for *includeDisplayName* is *false*.

Reports can be rendered as follows (ordering is implicit rather than explicit):

![A table showing an example of how a report can be rendered](https://files.readme.io/1fa20ca-Report1.png)

# Data model

## Dimensions
Unique identifier for your SMB in Codat.
Unique identifier for a company's data connection.

Assess reports follow a consistent structure. Reports contain four sections of information:

1. Report definition information such as:
  a. The report info (e.g. enhanced_profit_and_loss).
  b. The display name of the report (e.g. Enhanced Profit and Loss).
2. Information about the dimension contained in the reports such as:
  a. The type of dimension (e.g. datetime, recordRef).
  b. The display name of the dimension (e.g. Period, Category type, Category sub type).
  c. The details about each item within the dimension (e.g. displayName:"Jan 2022", start:"...", end:"...", id:"...", name:"...").
3. Information about the measures contained in the report such as:
  a. The display name of the measure (e.g. value of account, percentage change).
  b. The type of the measure (e.g. currency, percentage).
  c. The unit of the measure (e.g. %, GBP).
4. The data for the report. When the *includeDisplayName* parameter is set to *true*, it shows the *dimensionDisplayName* and *itemDisplayName* to make the data human-readable. The default setting for *includeDisplayName* is *false*.

parameters.description: If set to true, then the system includes the input values within the response.

schema.description: Unique identifier for your SMB in Codat.

post.summary: Request an Excel report for download

lastGenerated.description: In Codat's data model, dates and times are represented using the ISO 8601 standard. Date and time fields are formatted as strings; for example: ``` 2020-10-08T22:40:50Z 2021-01-01T00:00:00 ``` When syncing data that contains `DateTime` fields from Codat, make sure you support the following cases when reading time information: - Coordinated Universal Time (UTC): `2021-11-15T06:00:00Z` - Unqualified local time: `2021-11-15T01:00:00` - UTC time offsets: `2021-11-15T01:00:00-05:00` > 📘 Time zones > > Not all dates from Codat will contain information about time zones. > Where it is not available from the underlying platform, Codat will return these as times local to the business whose data has been synced.
lastGenerated.title: DateTime

get.summary: Enhanced Profit and Loss Accounts

currency.title: Currency
currency.description:
The currency data type in Codat is the [ISO 4217](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_4217) currency code. e.g. _GBP_.

## Unknown currencies

In line with the ISO 4217 specification, the code _XXX_ is used when the data source does not return a currency for a transaction. 

There are only a very small number of edge cases where this currency code is returned by the Codat system.

generatedDate.description: The date the report was generated.

parameters.name: reportDate
parameters.description: The date in which the report is created up to. Users must specify a specific date, however the response will be provided for the full month.

parameters.name: numberOfPeriods
parameters.description: The number of periods to return.  There will be no pagination as a query parameter, however Codat will limit the number of periods to request to 12 periods.

get.summary: Get key metrics for subscription revenue

schema.description:
Assess reports follow a consistent structure. Reports contain four sections of information:

1. Report definition information such as:
  a. The report info (e.g. enhanced_profit_and_loss).
  b. The display name of the report (e.g. Enhanced Profit and Loss).
2. Information about the dimension contained in the reports such as:
  a. The type of dimension (e.g. datetime, recordRef).
  b. The display name of the dimension (e.g. Period, Category type, Category sub type).
  c. The details about each item within the dimension (e.g. displayName:"Jan 2022", start:"...", end:"...", id:"...", name:"...").
3. Information about the measures contained in the report such as:
  a. The display name of the measure (e.g. value of account, percentage change).
  b. The type of the measure (e.g. currency, percentage).
  c. The unit of the measure (e.g. %, GBP).
4. The data for the report. When the *includeDisplayName* parameter is set to *true*, it shows the *dimensionDisplayName* and *itemDisplayName* to make the data human-readable. The default setting for *includeDisplayName* is *false*.

Reports can be rendered as follows (ordering is implicit rather than explicit):

![A table showing an example of how a report can be rendered](https://files.readme.io/1fa20ca-Report1.png)

# Data model

## Dimensions

Report.description:
Assess reports follow a consistent structure. Reports contain four sections of information:

1. Report definition information such as:
  a. The report info (e.g. enhanced_profit_and_loss).
  b. The display name of the report (e.g. Enhanced Profit and Loss).
2. Information about the dimension contained in the reports such as:
  a. The type of dimension (e.g. datetime, recordRef).
  b. The display name of the dimension (e.g. Period, Category type, Category sub type).
  c. The details about each item within the dimension (e.g. displayName:"Jan 2022", start:"...", end:"...", id:"...", name:"...").
3. Information about the measures contained in the report such as:
  a. The display name of the measure (e.g. value of account, percentage change).
  b. The type of the measure (e.g. currency, percentage).
  c. The unit of the measure (e.g. %, GBP).
4. The data for the report. When the *includeDisplayName* parameter is set to *true*, it shows the *dimensionDisplayName* and *itemDisplayName* to make the data human-readable. The default setting for *includeDisplayName* is *false*.

Reports can be rendered as follows (ordering is implicit rather than explicit):

![A table showing an example of how a report can be rendered](https://files.readme.io/1fa20ca-Report1.png)

There are only a very small number of edge cases where this currency code is returned by the Codat system.

detailType.description: Most granular chart of account type.

type.description: The data type which the data type in the URL has been matched against. For example, if you've matched accountTransactions and banking-transactions, and you call this endpoint with accountTransactions in the URL, this property would be banking-transactions.

lastMatched.description: The date the matching algorithm last ran against the company’s data type specified.

currentStatus.description: The current status of the most recently run matching algorithm.

statusMessage.description: Detailed explanation supporting the status value.

source.description: An array of strings. The connection IDs for the type specified in the url.

target.description: An array of strings. The connection IDs for the type being matched to.

amounts.description: Only returned for transactions. For accounts, there is nothing returned.

currency.title: Currency
currency.description:
The currency data type in Codat is the [ISO 4217](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_4217) currency code. e.g. _GBP_.

## Unknown currencies

In line with the ISO 4217 specification, the code _XXX_ is used when the data source does not return a currency for a transaction. 

There are only a very small number of edge cases where this currency code is returned by the Codat system.

dates.description: Only returned for transactions. For accounts, there is nothing returned.

minOverlappingDate.description: Earliest date where transactions exist in both accounting and banking platforms.

maxOverlappingDate.description: Latest date where transactions exist in both account and banking platforms.

type.description: The data type which the data type in the URL has been matched against. For example, if you've matched accountTransactions and banking-transactions, and you call this endpoint with accountTransactions in the URL, this property would be banking-transactions.

matchPercentage.description: The percentage of the absolute value of transactions of the type specified in the route which have a match.

unmatched.description: The sum of the absolute value of transactions of the type specified in the route which don't have a match.

matched.description: The sum of the absolute value of transactions of the type specified in the route which have a match.

total.description: The total of unmatched and matched.

currency.title: Currency
currency.description:
The currency data type in Codat is the [ISO 4217](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_4217) currency code. e.g. _GBP_.

## Unknown currencies

In line with the ISO 4217 specification, the code _XXX_ is used when the data source does not return a currency for a transaction. 

There are only a very small number of edge cases where this currency code is returned by the Codat system.

matchPercentage.description: The percentage of records of the type specified in the route which have a match.

unmatched.description: The number of records of the type specified in the route which don't have a match.

matched.description: The number of records of the type specified in the route which do have a match.

total.description: The total of unmatched and matched.

id.description: A concatenation of the accountId and transactionId, in the format accountId_transactionId. This is unique to data integrity.

type.description: The data type of the record.

connectionId.description: ID GUID representing the connection of the accounting or banking platform.

id.description: A concatenation of the accountId and transactionId, in the format accountId_transactionId. This is unique to data integrity.

type.description: The data type which the data type in the URL has been matched against. For example, if you've matched accountTransactions and banking-transactions, and you call this endpoint with accountTransactions in the URL, this property would be banking-transactions.

connectionId.description: ID GUID representing the connection of the accounting or banking platform.

fromDate.description: The date from which the report starts.

toDate.description: The date on which the report ends (inclusive of day).

value.description:
The top level metric value that is calculated for the specified period. 

If the system cannot calculate for that period, the value will be null. The system will still show the metric inputs.

name.description: The name of the metric input e.g. “Current Assets”, “Capital Expenditure”.

value.description: The positive or negative number of the input value.
